Pre-Game Insights: The Cricket Cranes are set for their ICC T20 World Cup debut when they take on Afghanistan on Tuesday morning.
Captain Brian Masaba wants the boys to play the match, not the teams.
Uganda got a chance to meet Team Australia where they incidentally shared a hotel within Trinidad and Tobago.
Opening against Afghanistan is not an easy feat but victory will belong to the brave.
Captain Brian Masaba wants the boys to play the match, not the teams.
We are going out there to try and win cricket matches. At the end of the day, it is just cricket despite it being the World Cup.
It is important for us to take care of the process and not worry too much about the result.
If we can do that as a team we shall get the results we are looking for
Ugandans will have to be up in the wee hours of the morning in order to catch their favourite team but it will definitely prove worth it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Uganda came into this tournament as the little-known, East African nation that made it to the grand stage perhaps by accident to those on the outside looking in.
Uganda defeated Zimbabwe in the qualifiers in Namibia and secured the spot in unprecedented fashion.
The Uganda Cricket Association (UCA) has brought in Abhay Sharma as the coach for the World Cup.
The coach is big on processes and situations, something he has tried to instil in this group of players.
The time for preparations is done and now it is time for the players to act on the work they have done so far.
The idea that they will soon play on the same pitches with these stars will probably give them the push they need to believe in the ability that brought them this far.
These players will have to put the excitement of the moment behind them and embrace the rollercoaster journey this could become.
